Title: Secret scanning validity checks available for Enterprise Cloud with data residency
Description:
Expanded platform support GitHub Enterprise Cloud with data residency and Enterprise Server Enterprise Cloud with data residency: Starting today, validity checks are now available for GitHub Secret Protection and GitHub…

The post [Secret scanning validity checks available for Enterprise Cloud with data residency](https://github.blog/changelog/2025-09-10-secret-scanning-validity-checks-available-for-data-residency) appeared first on [The GitHub Blog](https://github.blog).
Author: Allison
EnhancedContent:
### Expanded platform support GitHub Enterprise Cloud with data residency and Enterprise Server - **Enterprise Cloud with data residency**: Starting today, validity checks are now available for GitHub Secret Protection and GitHub Advanced Security customers on GitHub Enterprise Cloud with data residency. Once enabled for a given repository, GitHub will now automatically verify secrets for alerts with [supported token types](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-cloud@latest/code-security/secret-scanning/introduction/supported-secret-scanning-patterns#default-patterns). - **Enterprise Server**: Validity checks will also be available in an upcoming release of GitHub Enterprise Server. Keep an eye on the GitHub changelog for more information. ### Validators added for SSLMate and Typeform In addition, GitHub has added support for the following additional token types: | Provider | Pattern | Validity | | --- | --- | --- | | Typeform | `typeform_personal_access_token` | ✓ | | SSLMate | `sslmate_api_key`
\* | ✓ | \*Validation is available for the following token versions: `sslmate_api_key` , `sslmate2_api_key` .
